member.name: T:Lumenera.Range`1
member.summary: Type to store the span (range) of a set of values. This is a value type (struct) because it is small and because it makes it easy for us to compare ranges. Note that all ranges are inclusive of their endpoints.

member.summary: Minimum of range.

member.summary: Maximum of range.

member.summary: An unspecified range (a range of [0,0]).

member.summary: Create a range with the specified minimum and maximum values.

member.name: M:Lumenera.Range`1.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: A degenerate case where the range collapses to an exact value.

member.name: M:Lumenera.Range`1.ToString
member.summary: Format the range as a string. Note that the range is inclusive so the textual representation of the range uses square brackets (per https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_31-11).
member.returns: The formatted string.

member.name: M:Lumenera.Range`1.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Format the range as a string.
member.param: A format specifier valid for the numerical type. Intended for floating point types to control the number of decimal places printed.
member.returns: The formatted string.

member.name: T:Lumenera.USB.dll
member.summary: lucamapi.dll interface class.

member.name: F:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamImageFormatSize
member.summary: Can't use sizeof() on LucamImageFormat in C# so use this constant instead to initialize LucamImageFormat.size. Also, a struct can't have a parameterless constructor that just initializes the size and there are too many fields for a do-all constructor.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamCameraOpen(System.Int32)
member.summary: Open a camera.
member.remarks: For LucamExternalInterface.USB2, it forces a reenumeration. So, in that case, it isn't possible to reliably open a specific camera by index. Instead, use LucamExternalInterface.USB3 which will also enumerate USB2 devices.
member.param: The camera number. This is a number from 1 to the number of connected cameras.
member.returns: Camera handle to be used in subsequent API calls that perform operations on this specific camera.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamEnumCameras(Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamVersion[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Enumerate the list of connected cameras.
member.remarks: Returns the device enumeration determined by (). If LucamNumCameras() hasn't been called, it will be called internally.
member.param: An array of structures, one for each connected camera. The caller must allocate the array of sufficient dimensions to accommodate the number of connected cameras. This means in practice that the caller must determine the number of cameras first.
The number of entries available in 'v'.
member.returns: The number of connected cameras.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamGetLastError
member.summary: Query the error code for the last API error (not camera specific - for camera specific error, see ().
member.returns: The error code.
member.seealso: Camera specific error function - important if your application connects to more than one camera at a time.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamNumCameras
member.summary: Query the number of connected cameras.
member.remarks: Performs the actual device enumeration.
member.returns: The number of cameras.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamSelectExternInterface(Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamExternalInterface)
member.summary: Select which physical interface API will operate on.
member.remarks: USB1, USB2 and USB3 all enumerate all version of USB devices.
member.returns: False if there is an error.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamAddRgbPreviewCallback(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamRgbPreviewCallback,System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPixelFormat)
member.summary: Register an RGB frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera. If called after the stream is started the pixel format must match LucamQueryRgbPreviewPixelFormat(). If called before then it can be any format that is valid for the current pixel depth of the camera. If the requested pixel format is not the default value there may be a data copy (minor performance cost). Note that the image buffer is upside down and that the color values are in BGR order.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamAddSnapshotCallback(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamStreamingCallback,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Register a raw snapshot frame event callback.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveSnapshotCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamAddStreamingCallback(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamStreamingCallback,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Register a raw stream video frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamConvertFrameToRgb24(System.IntPtr,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPixelFormat,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamConversion@)
member.summary: Convert an 8-bit raw frame to RGB format. The first pixel in the output will be the bottom left pixel in the image. The color values are in BGR order.
member.param: RGB data byte array. Must be big enough to store the RGB 24 image (width * height * 3).
Raw data byte array. Must be big enough to store the raw data frame (width * height * bytes per pixel (for the selected pixel format)).
Width of the image frame (in pixels).
Height of the image frame (in pixels).
Pixel format of the raw data buffer.
Color converion specification (demosaicing and color correction matrix)
member.returns: False if there is an error.

member.summary: Setting the requested subsampling in LucamFrameFormat failed. Could be due to DirectShow filter not being installed.

member.summary: Facilitate the use of the Lucam API with appropriate .NET datatypes (E.g. arrays, Rectangles, Size, Offset, Point, etc.) and provide helper functions to perform common Lucam tasks associated with Lucam API calls. member.returns: the pixel format

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.AddRgbPreviewCallback(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamRgbPreviewCallback,System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPixelFormat)
member.summary: Register an RGB frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera. If called after the stream is started the pixel format must match LucamQueryRgbPreviewPixelFormat(). If called before then it can be any format that is valid for the current pixel depth of the camera. If the requested pixel format is not the default value there may be a data copy (minor performance cost). Note that the image buffer is upside down and that the color values are in BGR order.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.RemoveRgbPreviewCallback(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deregister an RGB frame event callback.

member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveSnapshotCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.summary: Deregister a snapshot raw frame event callback.

member.summary: Register a raw stream video frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera.

member.summary: Take synchronous snapshots.

The byte[][] type is a sparse array (an array of arrays) which requires that each of the first dimension (leftmost index) be initialized with a byte array (e.g. new byte[imageSize]). member.name: F:Lumenera.VideoPanel.processing
member.summary: Processing of Windows messages is synchronous (single thread) but not guaranteed to be in a certain order. When the events happen slowly the cascade of events for one zoom/scroll step get a chance to complete before the next one starts. If they happen faster (autorepeat keystrokes, fast mouse wheel) a message from a subsequent repeat may be processed before processing of the current repeat is finished.

member.name: M:Lumenera.VideoPanel.applyZoom(System.Double,Lumenera.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: Zoom keeping specified point at the same mouse coordinates.

member.name: M:Lumenera.VideoPanel.ScrollToControl(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Stop the active control from jumping to (0,0) when the form gains control. This was also a bitch to figure out. I ended up overriding everything that sounded like it might happen when a form gains focus till I found out which fn was responsible.

member.name: M:Lumenera.ImageStream.DoFrame(Lumenera.ImageEncoding,System.Object,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Invoke an image frame to the delegate provided in the constructor. Calculate the effective framerate. Delivery is asynchronous. All implementations of LiveImageStream must support locking of the data buffers via HoldFrame() and ReleaseFrame() or by copying the data buffer. Subsequent frames will be ignored until the asyncronous delegate completes.
member.param: The image object of the indicated image type.
Size (in bytes) of the image data.
Resource identifier later passed to DisposeFrame().

member.name: P:Lumenera.ImageStream.IsAsynchronousDataReadWrite
member.summary: Is the asynchronous data buffer a pipeline buffer that supports altering (filtering) the data input to the next stage of the processing pipeline.

member.name: P:Lumenera.ImageStream.IsSynchronousDataReadWrite
member.summary: Is the synchronous data buffer a pipeline buffer that supports altering (filtering) the data input to the next stage of the processing pipeline.

member.name: P:Lumenera.ImageStream.SynchronousFrameHandler
member.summary: Raw processing function. Runs in the context of the raw stream which may be a different thread than the GUI so not allowed to interact directly with GUI. Processing will affect the framerate if it isn't finished when the next frame is ready. Useful when there are calculations that need to be done at the full framerate and the asynchronous processing might take too much time to be performed on every frame.

member.name: T:Lumenera.VideoBox
member.summary:
An extended PictureBox with the following features: - Zoom (in AutoSize mode). - Uses blocky pixels so individual pixels can be observed at high zoom ratios and high quality interpolation for zoom < 1 for good image rendering, even of raw bayer images. - Optimized for frequent Image updates (e.g. a video stream). - Fixes bugs in PictureBox painting, particularly with high resolution images. - Adds MouseImageMove to give the coordinate under the mouse while moving. - Adds MouseImageEnter/Leave for when the mouse enters/leaves the image.
To get scrollbars, put a VideoBox/PictureBox in a Panel, use AutoSize mode, set panel to AutoScroll.

member.name: M:Lumenera.VideoBox.MouseToImagePosition(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Translate client rectangle location to image coordinates.
member.returns: Image position.

member.name: M:Lumenera.VideoBox.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Buffering inside the PictureBox paint code can fail with large images/zoom factors. Just draw the image by brute force when this happens. Note that turning off double buffering seems to prevent this error from happening.

member.name: P:Lumenera.VideoBox.ImageSize
member.summary: Size of Image or, in the absence of an image (Image is null), a size provided by the application, for example, when DirectX is drawing the image externally. Should be reset to Size.Empty when the application is no longer drawing (or the background will not update properly). Note that this is the image dimensions, not the display dimensions. For display information, see DrawingRectangle, ZoomX, ZoomY.
